description:
For years, declining birth rates have forced what's left of the human race to cede more and more territory to other beings who have appeared to take advantage of the emptying ecological niche. Now, only a handful of humans remain among the remnants of civilization and Earth is dominated by faeries —tiny, ten-inch tall creatures of surprising intelligence. But humanity's importance isn't over quite yet, as young Watashi learns as she makes the decision to return to her hometown and assume her grandfather's position as an arbitrator between the races. Unfortunately, the job isn't going to be anywhere near as simple as she expected, and it's going to take a wisdom far beyond her years to achieve her most important mission.

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: ตัวฉันกับวันสิ้นโลก

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Fairy
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a fairy.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Achronological Order
tags.description: Chapters or episodes do not occur in chronological order.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Time Loop
tags.description: A character is stuck in a repetitive cycle that they are attempting to break out of. This is distinct from a manipulating time of their own choice.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

node.description:
[Profile](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/9) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kowotani)

After graduating from university, he became a founding member of Yuji Saito's music production company IMAGINE in November 1986. The company has grown to feature musicians like Kohei Tanaka, Shiro Hamaguchi, Hayato Matsuo, and Shinji Miyazaki, who have become well known for cinematic scoring and orchestration through Otani. 

In 1987, he made his debut as an anime composer with the popular manga adaptation City Hunter, which earned him recognition in the industry. He later went on to work on titles such as Spy Games (1988), The Ultimate Teacher (1988), The Yadamura Waltz (1988), and You're Under Arrest (1994). The anime Future GPX Cyber Formula (1991) and Mobile Suit Gundam Wing (1995) and several films in the Gamera series are some of his most well-known works.  In 2001, he created the score to the film Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack. Other notable scores by Otani include Outlaw Star (1998), Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz (1998), Cross Fire (2000), The SoulTaker (2001), Haibane Renmei (2002), Zatch Bell! (2003), Eyeshield 21 (2005), Pumpkin Scissors (2006), Deltora Quest (2007), and Over Drive (2007). He has also been the music director and keyboardist of the band Dreams Come True. He appeared at Eminence Symphony Orchestra's events A Night in Fantasia 2007: Symphonic Games Edition and Unearthing Eden ~The sounds of AINARU~ in 2007.  

Throughout his career, Otani has also composed music for several video games, making his debut with the 1995 shooter game Philosoma. In 2000, he created the soundtrack to the flight simulator Sky Odyssey. He scored Shadow of the Colossus in 2005, his most famous video game work. Otani was responsible for composing the music for Wild Arms: Twilight Venom (2000), an anime adaptation of the Wild Arms video game series; he also arranged compositions of Michiko Naruke's music from the series. He did two more video game to anime adaptations: Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge (1997) and Popolocrois Monogatari (1998). In 2005, he created the track "Madness" alongside Hiroko Shigezumi for the Square Enix game Heavy Metal Thunder.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/manakare_i)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tobesuna)

Non-anime roles:~!· Riviera: The Promised Land (DS game; Character Design)  
· Yggdra Union: We'll Never Fight Alone (DS game; Card Design)  
· Knights in the Nightmare (DS game; Illustration)  
· Summon Night: Twin Age ~Seiri-tachi no Koe~ (DS game; Character Design)  
· Reveal Fantasia (PS2 game; Character Design, Illustrations)  
· Concerto Gate (MMORPG; Character Design)  
· Duane Sirk (Light Novel; Illustrations)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/gennjousannzou)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Freelance since 2001.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Website](http://nanoripe.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nanoripe_info) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nano.ripe/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCL-qIf8MciqDx0VJsQDIsHw)

__Formed:__ 1998
__Genres:__ J-POP, Rock (Pop Rock)

__Introduction:__
nano.RIPE is a two-piece Japanese pop rock band under record label Lantis (2010–), affiliated with the entertainment office Highway Star. 

__Biography:__
The band was formed in 1998 with the members Kimiko and Jun who were classmates in their prefectural high school in Chiba. They debuted as an indie band in 2008, releasing one single and three albums before they eventually made their major debut in 2010, while also signing to record label Lantis in the same year.

__Members:__
- [Kimiko](https://anilist.co/staff/169452/Kimiko) (季美子, きみコ) – vocalist, guitarist, in-charge of lyrics (1998–)
- [Sasaki Jun](https://anilist.co/staff/169454/Jun-Sasaki) (佐々木淳, ササキジュン) – guitarist, chorus, in-charge of composition (1998–)

__Former Members:__
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist (2010–2016)
- Yuuki Aoyama (青山友樹) – drummer (2013–2016) ([deceased](https://natalie.mu/music/news/298104))
- shinn. – drummer (–2011)

__Support Members:__
- [Hiroki Takahashi](https://twitter.com/takahashi_drum) (高橋宏貴) – drummer
- [Abe Nobuyuki](https://twitter.com/nob_abe) (アベノブユキ) – bassist
- [Naoya "choku" Suzuki](https://twitter.com/choku_nary) (鈴木"choku"直也) – bassist
- [Takumi Sugama](https://twitter.com/sugamatakumi) (菅間匠) – drummer

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/PROJECT_ROMEO)

Also known as Hajime Yamada (pseudonym). Romeo Tanaka is a male Japanese freelance artist and scenario writer for bishoujo games and adult games. He attended the University of Tsukuba. In 2007, Tanaka started to write his first light novel series entitled Jinrui wa Suitaishimashita which is published by Shogakukan. He is notable for having a hand in the creation of works such as Kana ~Imouto~, Cross†Channel and Saihate no IMA, and co-authored the scenario for Key's game Rewrite.
He was originally part of Studio Live, but in 1995 switched over to Studio Fantasia.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.
In March 2010, she graduated from Tokyo Animation College.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/numa_milky)

Numata is best known for his strongly distorted character style and peculiar sense for timing, often being named as an animator of the [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) school. He tends to work together with character designer [Kyuuta Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/106111/), whose disproportionated character designs particularly fit his style, employing often large teardrops, which brought him to spotlight in [Higurashi no Naku Koro ni](https://anilist.co/anime/934/). The duo also participated together in several other shows, such as [Ichigo Mashimaro](https://anilist.co/anime/488/) and [Strawberry Panic](https://anilist.co/anime/855/).

Every now and then works under one of his many pseudonyms.

(Source: Anidb)
